wapi.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 12:10PM PST until January 17 at 4:00AM PST by NWS
wapi.description:
...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY
ABOVE 5000 FEET...
* WHAT...Snow showers today becoming steady snow tonight and
Monday, heavy at times. Windy with 20 to 30 mph winds gusting
to 50 mph. Snow levels will vary between 5000 and 7000 feet.
* WHERE...San Bernardino County Mountains and Riverside County
Mountains.
* WHEN...Through 4 AM Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Total snow accumulations by Tuesday
morning...3 to 8 inches from 5000 to 6000 feet, 8 to 15 inches
from 6000 to 7000 feet, and 1 to 2 feet above 7000 feet.
wapi.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.
For road condition information in California...enter
8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or
9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.

wapi.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 15 at 9:57AM PST until further notice by NWS
wapi.description:
...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY...
* WHAT...Significant flow expected in the Whitewater River and the
Coachella Storm Water Channel through Tuesday morning.
* WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following
county, Riverside.
* WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Some low-water
crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are
elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 948 AM PST, Heavy rain has fallen over the San Bernardino
Mountains and will be draining into the Whitewater watershed
through Tuesday morning. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have
fallen over the watershed in the San Bernardino mountains.
- Additional rain is expected over the area tonight through
Monday morning. This additional rain will continue the flow
through the Coachella Canal through Tuesday morning.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Southern Indio, northern Palm Springs, Coachella, Cathedral
City, Palm Desert, Rancho Mirage, Thermal, Whitewater, La
Quinta and Mecca.
- https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
wapi.instruction:
Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

wapi.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 15 at 2:22PM PST until January 16 at 10:00AM PST by NWS
wapi.description:
...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY...
* WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 55 mph expected.
Local gusts to 65 mph on the ridges and desert slopes of the
San Diego County Mountains.
* WHERE...San Diego County Mountains, Apple and Lucerne Valleys,
Coachella Valley, San Diego County Deserts and San Gorgonio
Pass Near Banning.
* WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Monday.
* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.
Hazardous travel for high profile vehicles.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds will continue into early
Tuesday morning but will be part of the Winter Weather Advisory.
wapi.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

wapi.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 12:10PM PST until January 17 at 4:00PM PST by NWS
wapi.description:
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MONDAY TO
4 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET...
* WHAT...Total snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches through
Tuesday.
West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts 40 to 55 mph.
* WHERE...San Diego County Mountains.
* WHEN...From 10 AM Monday to 4 PM PST Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Some brief snow showers are possible this
evening, but the snow levels will rise into Monday morning,
then fall during the day.
wapi.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
For road condition information in California...enter
8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or
9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
